statement.p:
There were 300 lizards on a small island in 2000, and since then the population has been growing by 15% each year.
Write a formula for the size of the lizard population t years after 2000.
Write an equation to calculate how long it will take the lizard population to reach 500.
Use trial and error to estimate the solution to the equation.

introduction.p: For Problems 3 and 4, use the definition to find each logarithm without using a calculator.
For Problems 58, solve. Round your answers to hundredths.

statement.p:
Rewrite each equation in logarithmic form.
t^{3/2} = 16
0.8^{1.2} = M
3.7^{2.5} = Q
3^{-0.2t} = 2N_0

Rewrite each equation in logarithmic form.
\log_{16}{256} = w
\log_b{9} = -2
\log_{10}{a} = -2.3
\log_4 {36} = 2q-1

Solve each equation, writing your answer as a logarithm. Then use trial and error to approximate the logarithm to tenths.
4^x = 2.5
2^x = 0.2

introduction.p: For Problems 1214, use a graph to approximate each logarithm to the nearest hundredth. (Hint: Graph an appropriate function y=b^x.)

The atmospheric pressure decreases with altitude above the surface of the Earth, according to the function P(h) = 30 (10)^{-0.09h} where h is altitude given in miles, and P is atmospheric pressure in inches of mercury. Graph this function in the window {\text{Xmin}} \amp = 0 \amp\amp {\text{Xmax}} = 9.4 {\text{Ymin}} \amp = 0 \amp\amp {\text{Ymax}} = 30 Solve the problems 15 and 16 algebraically, then verify with your graph.

ol.Label: a

li.p: The elevation of Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world, is 29,028 feet. What is the atmospheric pressure at the top?

ol.li: The atmospheric pressure at the top of Mount McKinley, the highest peak in the United States, is 13.51 inches of mercury. Estimate the elevation of Mount McKinley.

ol.Label: a
ol.li: What is the atmospheric pressure at sea level (h=0)?
Find the height above sea level at which the atmospheric pressure is equal to one-half the pressure at sea level.

statement.p:
From 1950 to 2000, the population of the state of Nevada increased according to the formula P(t) = 162,000 (10)^{0.02191t} where t is measured in years since 1950.
What was the population in 2000?
What was the annual percent growth rate from 1950 to 2000?
According to this model, when would the population of Nevada reach 3,000,000? (In fact the population of Nevada was 3,139,658 in 2020.)

From 1970 to 1990, the population of the state of California increased according to the formula P(t) = 19,971,000 (10)^{0.0088t} where t is measured in years since 1970.
What was the population in 1990?
What was the annual percent growth rate from 1970 to 1990?
According to this model, when would the population of California reach 40,000,000? (In fact the population of California was 39,747,267 in 2020.)

introduction.p: Equations Practice: For Problems 19 and 20, solve the equation and check your solutions.
